mdRecord.dcterms:title: While there's life, there's hope: As sung by Mr. John Collins, the celebrated Irish comedian and vocalist, in Broughham's [i.e., Brougham's] play of the "Duke's motto" at Niblo's Garden, New York
Never lose heart, where'er thou art
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Magnus, Charles.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Published by Chs. Magnus 12 Frankfort St. N.Y.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil War song sheet, in 2 verses and chorus (repeated after each verse); without music. Printed in blue on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue. Song in two stanzas on illustrated letter paper.
The American premiere of Duke's motto ran at Niblo's Garden, New York City from June 1 to August 25, 1863. See Odell, G. Annals of the New York stage, 1927, vol. VII, p. 487.
Hand-colored headpiece has caption "Rendez-vous of Distribution, Va. No. 2" -- a variant of Magnus 93, which is unnumbered. Cf. Library Company of Philadelphia, American song sheets, 2601c.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Sixteenth of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Hope--Songs and music--Texts.
